title: Associate Machine Learning Research Scientist - Secure AI Lab
description: At the SEI AI Division, we conduct research in applied artificial intelligence and the engineering questions related to the practical design and implementation of AI technologies and systems. As part of the world-class research community at Carnegie Mellon University, the Lab conducts and applies cutting-edge research to protect AI systems from adversaries who aim to manipulate the system to learn, do, or reveal something it isnâ€™t supposed to. At the SEI AI Division, we conduct research in applied artificial intelligence and the engineering questions related to the practical design and implementation of AI technologies and systems. We currently lead a community-wide movement to mature the discipline of AI Engineering for Defense and National Security.Â 

As our government customers adopt AI and machine learning to provide leap-ahead mission capabilities, weÂ 

Â· Â  Â  Â  build real-world, mission-scale AI capabilities through solving practical engineering problemsÂ 

Â· Â  Â  Â  discover and define the processes, practices, and tools to support operationalizing AI for robust, secure, scalable, and human-centered mission capabilitiesÂ 

Â· Â  Â  Â  prepare our customers to be ready for the unique challenges of adopting, deploying, using, and maintaining AI capabilitiesÂ 

Â· Â  Â  Â  identify and investigate emerging AI and AI-adjacent technologies that are rapidly transforming the technology landscapeÂ 

Are you creative, curious, energetic, collaborative, technology-focused, and hard-working? Are you interested in making a difference by bringing innovation to government organizations and beyond? Apply to join our team.Â 

Overview: As an Associate Machine Learning Research Scientist, you will specialize in conducting machine learning research.Â 

The Secure AI Lab within the SEIâ€™s AI Division focuses on improving the security and robustness of AI systems. As part of the world-class research community at Carnegie Mellon University, the Lab conducts and applies cutting-edge research to protect AI systems from adversaries who aim to manipulate the system to learn, do, or reveal something it isnâ€™t supposed to. Â 

The Secure AI Lab consists of machine learning research scientists, machine learning engineers, and software developers who work together to solve problems in the following areas:Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  AI/ML Algorithm Attack Research: Study threat models targeting AI/ML algorithms, identify weak points, and design novel ways to subvert AI/ML systems. Â Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  AI/ML Algorithm Defense Research: Create practical mitigations and defenses for observed attacks affecting AI/ML algorithms and evaluate the effectiveness of defensive techniques.Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Applied AML: Advance the state of the art in adversarial machine learning by developing and transitioning capabilities to government sponsors.Â 

Your day-to-day research tasks will include:Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Identifying and investigating emerging AI and AI-adjacent technologies.Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Performing and publishing impactful original research in the field of adversarial machine learning.Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Adapting and applying existing research in the field to solve real-world problems.Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Transitioning and providing guidance on AI capabilities to government sponsors.Â 

Duties:â€¯Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Hands-on research:â€¯Youâ€™ll conduct and lead novel research in applied machine learning and artificial intelligence.Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Solution development: Youâ€™ll work with and lead interdisciplinary teams to turn research results into prototype operational capabilities for government customers and stakeholders.Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Strategy:â€¯Youâ€™ll work with the leadership team and colleagues to plan, develop, and carry out an overall research strategy, and to influence the national research agenda regarding future technology.Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Collaboration:â€¯You'll actively participate on teams of software developers, researchers, designers, and technical leads. You'll build relationships and collaborate with researchers, government customers, and other stakeholders to understand challenges, needs, possible solutions, and research directions.Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Mentoring: You'll contribute to improving the overall technical capabilities of the Center by mentoring and teaching others, participating in design (software and otherwise) sessions, and sharing insights and wisdom across the SEI AI Division.Â 

Knowledge and ExperienceÂ 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Comprehensive knowledge of machine learning

Â· Â  Â  Â  A track record of conducting research and applying scientific methods to solve difficult problemsÂ 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Experience leading research projects in novel areas with limited previous work to build uponÂ 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Ability to work with leadership to plan, develop, and deliver an overall research strategyÂ 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Strong written and verbal communication skills; ability to convey complex technical ideas in a laypersonâ€™s termsÂ 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Proficiency in writing funding proposals or pitching ideas for new research projectsÂ 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Ample experience with publishing written or technical artifacts showcasing your workÂ 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Strong collaboration skills for working with colleagues and sponsors Â 

Â· Â  Â  Â  Willingness to guide and mentor junior team membersÂ 

RequirementsÂ

Â· Â  Â You will be subject to a background investigation and must be able to obtain and maintain a Department of Defense security clearance.Â 

Â· Â  Â Legally authorized to work for Carnegie Mellon University in the United States. CMU will not sponsor or take over sponsorship of an employment visa for this opportunity.Â
